items.title: Tech industry layoffs hit 100,000 for 2025 — Intel leading the pack with over 12,000 personnel cut, so far
items.summary: Tech industry layoffs have reached 100,000 for 2025, with Intel leading the pack by cutting over 12,000 positions. Microsoft and Meta have also reduced their workforce by 10,000 and 8,000 people respectively.

items.title: Tesla sells off after Elon Musk scraps his 2025 sales growth target and warns ‘we could have a few rough quarters’
items.summary: Tesla stock sells off as Elon Musk scraps 2025 sales growth target and warns of challenging quarters ahead, with lack of specific details on robotaxi service with only 7,000 driverless miles logged.

items.title: Tesla sells off after Elon Musk scraps his 2025 sales growth target and warns ‘we could have a few rough quarters’
items.summary: Tesla sells off after Elon Musk scraps his 2025 sales growth target and warns ‘we could have a few rough quarters’ - The Tesla CEO hosted an earnings call once more long on promises and short on specifics, especially regarding his month-old robotaxi service that has logged.

items.title: Elon Musk set to revive Vine but with an AI twist. Could this be a YouTube killer?
items.summary: Elon Musk plans to relaunch Vine with artificial intelligence, potentially posing a threat to YouTube. Vine was known for its six-second looping videos before shutting down in 2016. The revival will be driven by AI technology.

items.summary: A passenger on a Delta flight was pleasantly surprised to find out that their seat neighbor was a golden retriever, due to an AI-generated voice assigning seats. This unconventional seatmate experience highlights the use of AI in passenger seating and interactions.
